metadata.title: CVE-2024-26898 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: aoe:fix the potential use-after-free problem in aoecmd_cfg_pkts This patch isagainst CVE-2023-6270. The description of cve is: A flaw was found in theATA over Ethernet (AoE) driver in the Linux kernel. The aoecmd_cfg_pkts()function improperly updates the refcnt on `struct net_device`, and ause-after-free can be triggered by racing between the free on the structand the access through the `skbtxq` global queue. This could lead to adenial of service condition or potential code execution. Inaoecmd_cfg_pkts(), it always calls dev_put(ifp) when skb initial code isfinished. But the net_device ifp will still be used in latertx()->dev_queue_xmit() in kthread. Which means that the dev_put(ifp) shouldNOT be called in the success path of skb initial code in aoecmd_cfg_pkts().Otherwise tx() may run into use-after-free because the net_device is freed.This patch removed the dev_put(ifp) in the success path inaoecmd_cfg_pkts(), and added dev_put() after skb xmit in tx().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26898` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-226-generic - 4.15.0-226.238
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-226-generic - 4.15.0-226.238
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-226-lowlatency - 4.15.0-226.238
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-189-generic - 5.4.0-189.209~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-189-lowlatency - 5.4.0-189.209~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1153-kvm - 4.15.0-1153.158
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1169-aws - 4.15.0-1169.182
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1133-azure - 5.4.0-1133.140~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1163-gcp - 4.15.0-1163.180
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1132-gcp - 5.4.0-1132.141~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1075-ibm - 5.4.0-1075.80~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-226.238').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-189.209~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1153.158').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1169.182').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.3').
linux-aws-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.4').
linux-aws-5.4 package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.4.0-1128.138~18.04.1').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-5.3').
linux-azure-4.15 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1178.193').
linux-azure-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-5.4').
